shared.network.rmi

Class NetworkRmi

  • java.lang.Object
    • shared.network.rmi.NetworkRmi
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, Connection

    public class NetworkRmi
extends java.lang.Object
implements Connection

    This class implements Connection and all its methods, using the Remote Method Invocation networking to set up the connection components.


    Using the constructor with no parameters or just an Integer representing the RMI port, the instance will act as a server, creating also an RMI registry on teh same machine;

    using the constructor with only a String parameter representing the server's hostname, or also with an Integer parameter representing the server's inbound port, the instance will act as a client, trying to connect to the specified hostname.


    To choose the server's address from the outside (even from user input) a static setter is provided ( setServerAddress(String)); is must be used before calling the constructor, otherwise the server will be started on localhost

    See Also:
    SharedProxyServer, SharedProxyClient, Connection

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Called automatically when an instance is used in a try-with-resources
      void export(java.lang.Object o, java.lang.String n)
      Register on the connection's server an Object, binding it to a name; then it will be callable through its reference obtained by Connection.getExported(String)
      <T> T getExported(java.lang.String name)
      Obtain a reference to a registered object, which should have been prior exported using Connection.export(Object, String); this is a generic method which will convert the returned reference into the destination type, for example:
      DestClass dc = getExported("Foo")
      will try to obtain an exported reference, bound to the name "Foo", and then will try to cast it into the destination type DestClass
      java.lang.Integer getListeningPort()
      Obtain the port on which the Connection instance will accept or send
      java.lang.String getLocalIp()
      Obtain the IPv4 address of the machine on which is being run the instance of Connection you call this method on
      java.lang.Object invokeMethod(java.lang.String callee, java.lang.String methodName, java.lang.Object[] argList)
      Perform a method call through a network segment, from a Connection instance to another one on a different JVM or on the same one; you can call this method only on objects registered prior on the server through the Connection.export(Object, String) method.
      static java.rmi.Remote remotize(java.lang.Object o, java.lang.Integer p)
      This method prepare an implementation of Remote to be exported on the RMI registry; note that the export(Object, String) method should be called only by the server, on a remote reference to the client, which was before passed to this remotize method
      static void setServerAddress(java.lang.String address)
      Setter for the server address, that must be called before instantiating the class, to provide a different hostname than localhost

      • setServerAddress

        public static void setServerAddress(java.lang.String address)
        Setter for the server address, that must be called before instantiating the class, to provide a different hostname than localhost
        Parameters:
        address - an IPv4 address or a DNS hostname for the machine which has the RMI registry running on it

      • remotize

        public static java.rmi.Remote remotize(java.lang.Object o,
                                       java.lang.Integer p)
        This method prepare an implementation of Remote to be exported on the RMI registry; note that the export(Object, String) method should be called only by the server, on a remote reference to the client, which was before passed to this remotize method
        Parameters:
        o - a reference to the object that you want to export on the registry
        p - the local port at which the server will be able to reach the client - leave it 0 to let the OS choose
        Returns:
        a Remote reference to the exported object: this reference can then be passed to the server and exported on the registry

      • getExported

        public <T> T getExported(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: Connection
        Obtain a reference to a registered object, which should have been prior exported using Connection.export(Object, String); this is a generic method which will convert the returned reference into the destination type, for example:
        DestClass dc = getExported("Foo")
        will try to obtain an exported reference, bound to the name "Foo", and then will try to cast it into the destination type DestClass
        Specified by:
        getExported in interface Connection
        Type Parameters:
        T - destination type
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Returns:
        T
        See Also:
        Connection.getExported(String)

      • invokeMethod

        public java.lang.Object invokeMethod(java.lang.String callee,
                                     java.lang.String methodName,
                                     java.lang.Object[] argList)
                              throws MethodConnectionException
        Description copied from interface: Connection
        Perform a method call through a network segment, from a Connection instance to another one on a different JVM or on the same one; you can call this method only on objects registered prior on the server through the Connection.export(Object, String) method. You must keep a reference to the name used at export-time, to provide it as this method's first parameter
        Specified by:
        invokeMethod in interface Connection
        Parameters:
        callee - String
        methodName - String
        argList - Object[]
        Returns:
        Object
        Throws:
        MethodConnectionException - when there are connection issues with the server or when the desired object or method are not found on the RMI registry
        See Also:
        Connection.invokeMethod(String, String, Object[])
